title: Census Income Data Visualization & Predictive Modeling
description: Analyzed 32,561 rows of U.S. Census Bureau data to build income-based demographic profiles, producing 5 multivariate visualizations across variables including age, occupation, education, gender, and relationship status.
outcome: Delivered actionable marketing profiles segmented by the $50,000 income threshold, enabling UVW College to identify and target high-potential enrollment demographics.

title: Neural Network for Collision Prediction
description: Designed and trained a custom PyTorch neural network to predict robot collisions in a simulated environment, covering the full ML pipeline — data collection via sensor readings, DataLoader implementation, custom feedforward architecture, and backpropagation training.
outcome: Produced a trained model that enabled a simulated robot to navigate its environment autonomously, seeking goals while avoiding collisions based on real-time sensor input.

title: SmartHome Gesture Control Application
description: Built a full-stack gesture recognition system — an Android mobile app for recording and uploading 17 SmartHome gestures to a local Flask server, paired with a CNN-based classifier using cosine similarity to recognize gestures across numeric and device-control categories.
outcome: Delivered a working end-to-end gesture control pipeline from mobile capture to ML classification, accurately predicting gesture labels across a 17-class output space.

title: Automated Conference Session Scheduler
description: Built an optimization-based scheduling system for The Conference Exchange to automatically assign hundreds of conference sessions across rooms, timeslots, and days — handling speaker conflicts, plenary blackouts, topic clustering, room capacity, and equipment constraints.
outcome: Delivered a working scheduler with CSV output benchmarked against a manually created schedule from an experienced meeting planner, demonstrating measurable reduction in scheduling conflicts.
